018
019package org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal;
020
021import static java.lang.Integer.signum;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.NOT_FOUND;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
026
027import java.util.Comparator;
028
029import org.apiguardian.api.API;
030import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
031import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider;
032
033/**
034 *  <p>{@summary A comparator that works on a list of sort keys.}</p>
035 *  <p>Sometimes, a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a
036 *  rule based on the values themselves. Instead an ordered list of value
037 *  defines their sequence.</p>
038 *  <p>The implementation first determines the key for a given value, then it
039 *  looks up that key in the key list to determine the sort order. Values whose
040 *  keys are not in the key list are placed on the list, will be ordered based
041 *  on the order implied by the given comparator according their keys.</p>
042 *
043 *  @param  <T> The type to order.
044 *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may be
045 *      the same as the type itself.
046 *
047 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
048 *  @version $Id: ListBasedComparator.java 1007 2022-02-05 01:03:43Z tquadrat $
049 *  @since 0.0.5
050 *
051 *  @UMLGraph.link
052 */
053@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ListBasedComparator.java 1007 2022-02-05 01:03:43Z tquadrat $" )
054@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
055public class ListBasedComparator<T,K> implements Comparator<T>
056{
057        /*---------------*\
058    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
059        \*---------------*/
060    /**
061     *  A simple implementation of
062     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
063     *  that returns the instance itself as the sort order key.
064     *
065     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
066     *  @version $Id: ListBasedComparator.java 1007 2022-02-05 01:03:43Z tquadrat $
067     *
068     *  @param  <T> The type to order.
069     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
070     *      be the same as the type itself. At least, an instance of type
071     *      {@code T} must be assignable to {@code K}.
072     *
073     *  @UMLGraph.link
074     */
075    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ListBasedComparator.java 1007 2022-02-05 01:03:43Z tquadrat $" )
076    public static class SimpleKeyProvider<T,K extends T> implements KeyProvider<T,K>
077    {
078            /*---------*\
079        ====** Methods **======================================================
080            \*---------*/
081        /**
082         *  {@inheritDoc}
083         *
084         *  @return The instance itself as the sort order key; {@code null} if
085         *      the instance is {@code null} itself.
086         */
087        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
088        @Override
089        public final K getKey( final T instance ) { return (K) instance; }
090    }
091    //  class SimpleKeyProvider
092
093        /*------------*\
094    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
095        \*------------*/
096    /**
097     *  The comparator that is used to determine the sort order for instances
098     *  that do not have their keys in the list; may be {@code null}.
099     */
100    private final Comparator<? super K> m_Comparator;
101
102    /**
103     *  The key provider.
104     */
105    private final KeyProvider<T,K> m_KeyProvider;
106
107    /**
108     *  The list with the sort order keys.
109     */
110    private final K [] m_Keys;
111
112        /*--------------*\
113    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
114        \*--------------*/
115    /**
116     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
117     *
118     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
119     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
120     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
121     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
122     *      that are not listed.
123     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
124     */
125    @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked", "MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod"} )
126    public ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super K> comparator, final K [] keys )
127    {
128        m_Keys = requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" );
129        m_KeyProvider = requireNonNullArgument( keyProvider, "keyProvider" );
130        m_Comparator = requireNonNullArgument( comparator, "comparator" );
131    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
132
133        /*---------*\
134    ====** Methods **==========================================================
135        \*---------*/
136    /**
137     *  {@inheritDoc}
138     */
139    @Override
140    public final int compare( final T o1, final T o2 )
141    {
142        var retValue = 0; // Assuming that the values are equal …
143        if( o1 != o2 ) // Not identical …
144        {
145            /*
146             *  Retrieve the keys and get the index for the respective key. A
147             *  value of -1 (NOT_FOUND) indicates that the key was not found in
148             *  the list of keys and that the natural order should be used for
149             *  the respective entry.
150             */
151            final var key1 = m_KeyProvider.getKey( o1 );
152            final var index1 = searchKey( key1 );
153            assert index1 == NOT_FOUND || index1 >= 0;
154            final var key2 = m_KeyProvider.getKey( o2 );
155            final var index2 = searchKey( key2 );
156            assert index2 == NOT_FOUND || index2 >= 0;
157
158            if( index1 == index2 )
159            {
160                /*
161                 *  If both index values are not -1, this means that the keys
162                 *  are equals and therefore the instances are to be treated
163                 *  as equals, too.
164                 */
165                if( index1 == NOT_FOUND )
166                {
167                    //---* Both are not in the list *--------------------------
168                    retValue = signum( m_Comparator.compare( key1, key2 ) );
169                }
170            }
171            else
172            {
173                /*
174                 * That one that is in the list is less than the other one.
175                 */
176                if( index1 == NOT_FOUND )
177                {
178                    retValue = 1;
179                }
180                else if( index2 == NOT_FOUND )
181                {
182                    retValue = -1;
183                }
184                else
185                {
186                    /*
187                     * That one that is closer to the start of the list is less
188                     * than the other one.
189                     */
190                    retValue = signum( index1 - index2 );
191                }
192            }
193        }
194
195        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
196        return retValue;
197    }   //  compare()
198
199    /**
200     *  Searches the given key in the list.
201     *
202     *  @param  key The key.
203     *  @return The index in the list or
204     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NOT_FOUND}
205     *      ({@value org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants#NOT_FOUND})
206     *      if the key is not in the list.
207     */
208    private int searchKey( final K key )
209    {
210        /*
211         * Although using Arrays.binarySearch() looked a good idea at first
212         * place, it does not work as we are not allowed to sort the key's
213         * array, for obvious reasons.
214         */
215        var found = false;
216        var retValue = m_Keys.length;
217        while( !found && (--retValue >= 0) )
218        {
219            found = (key == m_Keys [retValue]) || (nonNull( key ) && key.equals( m_Keys [retValue] ));
220        }
221
222        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
223        return retValue;
224    }   //  searchKey()
225}
226//  class ListBasedComparator
227
228/*
229 *  End of File
230 */
